item.title: Report E-2025030396
item.description:
Report E-2025030396

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: United Parcel Service
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 25, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3109 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the impacted area. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030414
item.description:
Report E-2025030414

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:36 EST on 3/1, XPO-BIN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 gallons of acetone from a 5-gallon metal pail onto the trailer and dock floors. The pail fell through the pallet due to the weight of the freight above it, being punctured by the wood shards. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. ERTS generated waste ID: 229136-1. ERTS reported the spill to Infotrac and spoke to Tony, who provided the report number: 20250301-383565

item.title: Report X-2025031112
item.description:
Report X-2025031112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: WHITESTOWN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor III Keli Linn contacted safety report a Hazardous Spill. Keli stated they were removing a pallet containing UN3378, Sodium carbonate peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PG II, from trailer 552651. Keli stated they noticed that one bag on the side of the pallet was torn and had leaked inside of the plastic wrap. Keli stated she believes the tear in the bag was due to a load shift and the pallet rubbed against the wall of the trailer resulting in an 8-ounce spillage into the plastic wrap, and onto the trailer floor.

item.title: Report E-2025030270
item.description:
Report E-2025030270

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental personnel were dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, they observed an estimated two (2) ounces of material released from one (1) 330-gallon IBC plastic tote due to a loose cap on a faulty lid. SET Environmental personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the IBC tote. SET Environmental personnel used absorbent pads to wipe down the container and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with 2 drum liners. The incident generated a total of one (1) waste container. Contractor personnel replaced the lid of the IBC tote. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The waste generated will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2025030226

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading drums of paint related material from Precoat W it was observed that one drum had liquid underneath it. When examined it showed a hole in the drum and material was leaking out. It looked like the drum was impacted by a bolt from another drum. The drum was placed in an overpack and the spill was cleaned up in house and everything was contained.

item.title: Report X-2025030851
item.description:
Report X-2025030851

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-08
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/8/2025 at approximately 0700 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5156291 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 10 metal cans shrink-wrapped together on a wooden pallet, one of which sustained a pinhole-sized damage from an unknown source, resulting in spillage. The damaged container was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's Declaration for further transport. the remaining parts of the shipment will continue forward with an Amended Shipper's Declaration.
